comments.body: The documentation says to use `.write(set("typicode"))` here, but I think the documentation is wrong. Typescript generates an error if you do this, and rightly so in my opinion - doing this results in no value being written. `set()` is called internally by the `write()` function, so it shuldn't be needed.
Is `<Post>` not inferred automatically, here and in other places?

Correct - it's because I switched to using the real `lodash/fp` version of `concat` (which exists now!), instead of the manually declared version that used to exist in `lowdb-tests`. `concat` can't infer the correct type from the single argument it's given - there is just not enough information. Similar story in the other places, too.
